name: vbox_list_vms_status_info
description: List all VirtualBox VMs with their states, CPU, memory, and network configuration

args: VBoxManage list vms | awk -F'[{|}]' '{print $2}' | while read uuid; do echo "=== VM: $uuid ==="  && VBoxManage showvminfo $uuid --machinereadable | grep -E '^(name|memory|cpus|VMState)='; done

expected_output.example:
=== VM: 5fbaabe4-6b24-4b8c-9d3a-7c8e9f1a2b3c ===
name="Ubuntu-Server"
memory=4096
cpus=2
VMState="running"
=== VM: 9a8b7c6d-5e4f-3a2b-1c0d-9e8f7a6b5c4d ===
name="Windows-10"
memory=8192
cpus=4
